Method Detail

isFileScheme

public static final boolean isFileScheme(java.lang.String scheme)
Retrieves whether the passed scheme is a file scheme, comparison is case unsensitive.

Parameters:
scheme - the scheme to test, never null.
Returns:
true if is a file scheme.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if scheme is null.

fromURI

public static java.io.File fromURI(java.lang.String escapedURI)
                            throws URIException
Returns a file from a file: scheme URI string.

The passed uri might use the file: scheme or a null or empty scheme. Examples are: 

 file:/a/b/c.foo
 file:/a/b%20c/c%20d.foo
 file:/f:/docs/dox.xml
 file:/f:/docs/dox.xml
 /f:/docs%20forme.xml
 :/f:/docs.xml (extreme case)

The passed uri must be correctly escaped, so that it can be parsed by URIFactory.createURI(String).

Parameters:
escapedURI - a file uri
Returns:
a java.io.File for the passed uri
Throws:
URIException

fromURI

public static java.io.File fromURI(URI uri)
Returns a file from a file: scheme URI interface.

The passed uri might use the file: scheme or a null or empty scheme. Examples are: 

 file:/a/b/c.foo
 file:/a/b%20c/c%20d.foo
 file:/f:/docs/dox.xml
 file:/f:/docs/dox.xml
 /f:/docs%20forme.xml
 :/f:/docs.xml (extreme case)

Parameters:
uri - a file URI implementation
Returns:
a java.io.File for the passed uri

toURI

public static URI toURI(java.io.File file)
Transforms a file to an URI. The file: URI is local to the virtual machine. Corresponds to java.io.File.toURI() available from JDK1.4
